## Data Import

We are using the R Package CTIS to get access to the API Interface, more information on <https://github.com/CaroHaensch/CTIS>.

```{r Data Import}
devtools::install_github("CaroHaensch/CTIS")
library(CTIS)

CTIS_open_data_country(country = "Germany")

head(CTIS_open_data_country(indicator = "anxious_7d", type = "daily", 
                            country = "Germany", daterange = "20210101-20211231"))

countrylist <- list("Germany", "France", "India")


lapply(countrylist, function(x){CTIS_open_data_country(indicator = "anxious_7d", type = "daily", 
                                                       country = x, daterange = "20210101-20211231")})

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
